oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of Oral Calcium Propionate on Blood Calcium and Energy Metabolite Concentrations in Dairy Cows with Dystocia Fed a Prepartum Anionic Diet
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Benzaquen, Mauricio E.
Risco, Carlos A.
Erickson, Amanda
Melendez, Pedro
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: dystocia
total blood calcium
betahydroxybutyrate
on-esterified free fatty acid
oral calcium
propionate drench
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Results from research on the calcium and energy status of cows affected with dystocia have not been conclusive. We hypothesize that during early post-partum (pp), similar to cows with retained placenta and uterine prolapse, cows with dystocia develop subclinical hypocalcemia, as well as ketosis. Therefore, the objectives of this study were : (1) to describe the total blood calcium (tCa), betahydroxybutyrate (BOHB) and non-esterified free fatty acid (NEFA) concentrations in blood during the first 12 days pp in dairy cows with dystocia, 2) to determine if an oral calcium propionate drench at calving and 72 hours later improves blood calcium concentration and energy status.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2008; 235
